text:
This is an update to the Lenya menus, which includes the following:

Change from table layout to semantic markup (menus are nested unordered lists)
and markup with div tags where needed.  Fahrner Image Replacement is used for
tab images, making it easier to "skin" Lenya's menus.

The attached file is a zipped representation of the webapps/lenya/lenya/
directory, and should have the following structure:

resources
  css
    menu.xml
  menu
    images
      new
        *.gif
        nav
          *.gif
xslt
  menu
    *.xsl

The assumption here is that all files in this archive are to replace the
existing ones (sorry, I do not have Eclipse, so I could not create appropriate
patch files).  The images were added in a new directory so as to not to
interfere with the old - I would assume if this enhancement is accepted, that
the images would move up one directory.

Some things to note:
1.  It is recommended that when using XHTML as the serializer, to have by
default the XML prologue removed.  IE/Win would not like it.

2.  The (ampersand)(pound sign)160; values in the i18n files be removed and
replaced with regular spaces, because in my experience when switching to XHTML
serialization, accented A characters appear in their place.  The same goes for
the tabs and breadcrumb xsl files.

3.  This update does not contain enhancements to the default xsl files for the
publications, just the menus for Lenya.

4.  This update is based on the official 1.2.1 release (Dec. 29, 2004).

5.  Also note that no images for the CSS were created for the staging tab.  If
this needs creating, please let me know.

6.  I have not fully tested this in IE/Win - it works perfectly in Firefox 1.0.

7.  The design has been updated for the tabs and menus.

Created attachment 13963
Enhancements for Lenya menus

This file is a .tar.gz file.  If another format is needed, please let me know.

Created attachment 14104
Update to CSS, tab images and menu files in XSLT folder

This update includes the following:

1.  Fixes the bug in IE/Win where the Lenya logo was not showing.
2.  Removes the background images used to replace the text of the tabs and
replaces it with same-style tabs, but text is displayed in the tab.
3.  Tabs now expand to size of text when user of browser chooses to increase
text size.

Things to note:
1.  Sizes of tabs are in em units in CSS.
2.  Currently, with the provided XSL file, the label for the Site tab is
showing up as "info-authoring".  I'm not sure what to do here to make it appear
as "Site", or if Gregor's updates with i18n makes this happen.
3.  The updates Gregor has made for i18n have *NOT* been included in this
updated file (Gregor, I'm exhausted - can you integrate your new i18n stuff in
the new XSL files I have provided?)
4.  If the Staging tab is added, the overall width of the tabs area has to be
increased, as indicated in a comment in the CSS file above #lenya-areas.

I believe that's it.  Instructions for updated an existing Lenya install are
the same as when I posted the first set of updates.

in light of the variable size of tabs, i would do away with fixed widths. this
also means that no special provisions for staging need to be taken. 

also note that the info area wraps if the tabs are too wide. they need to be
fixed i presume.

i also noticed that if you are in the site or admin areas, the spacing of the
tabs seems off, likely as a consequence of loading the lenya UI css classes
there but not in admin. some rules may need an !important.

all in all, great job.
